interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is home to North Sentinel Island, whose inhabitants have no contact with outside civilization.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
In Japanese culture, blue and green are considered different shades of the same color.
Bolivia is the flattest country in the world and has the largest salt flat.
New Zealand's government has been sued by Eminem.
The U.S. has no official language at the federal level, despite English being the de facto language.
Nigeria is the most linguistically diverse country in Africa, with over 500 languages spoken.
Germany was the first country in the world to adopt Daylight Saving Time in 1916.
Indonesia has the world’s largest volcanic lake, Lake Toba.
Pakistan is home to the second highest mountain on Earth, K2.
Bangladesh has the world’s largest river delta – the Sundarbans.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
There are over 7,600 islands in the Philippines.
The Congo River is the world’s deepest river.
Ethiopia follows a calendar that is seven to eight years behind the Gregorian calendar.
Vietnam is home to the world’s largest cave, Son Doong.
Istanbul is the only city in the world on two continents.
Big Ben is not the name of the clock, but the bell inside the clock tower.
Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa’s highest peak, is in Tanzania.
Thailand is the world’s largest exporter of orchids.
South Africa has three capital cities, each serving a different branch of government.
Italy is home to the world’s smallest country, Vatican City.
Kenya is regarded as the birthplace of the modern safari.
Colombia is the world’s largest producer of emeralds.
South Korea has the fastest internet speeds in the world.
